subject: Fw: Fw: SGUA Website | Decommissioning old site

full_threads.body:
Hi Megs,

I hope you’re doing well.

Upon reviewing the issue, it appears the error is originating from the theme itself. Since this is a custom-built WordPress theme, I recommend reaching out to the developer to review and update the code accordingly.

Hi there,

Could you kindly look into the below issue and advise?

This is for: https://pipfeb25.wolfiq.cloud/

Thank you so much,


Megs Hollis | Marketing Manager

Proplab - Powering SGUA & Property Insurance Plus

E:megan.hollis@theproplab.com.au
www.sgua.com.au

www.pi-plus.com.au

The contents of this email (including any attachments) are confidential and may contain privileged information. Any unauthorised use of the contents is expressly prohibited. If you have received this email in error, please notify us immediately by Telephone or Email, and then destroy the mail and any attachments or documents.
From: Paul de Chalain <paul@anomaly.digital>
Sent: Tuesday, April 1, 2025 12:40 PM
To: Megs Hollis <megan.hollis@theproplab.com.au>
Subject: Re: Fw: SGUA Website | Decommissioning old site
Hi Megs,

Happy Tuesday!

Just to confirm that the spacing issue on PIP is resolved - please may you check on your side? Then regarding the font issue, please see below feedback:

The font issue is that Montesserat and Bumil aren't loading - These seem to be rolled directly into the minified package of the developer's set up - We can't do much for it unfrotunately - they have the original unminified code on their side. The font showing for us is helvetica - when it should be one of those fonts.


Please can you check this with a developer on your side?

Regards

Paul

On Mon, Mar 31, 2025 at 10:46 AM Megs Hollis <megan.hollis@theproplab.com.au> wrote:
Hello Paul!

Apologies for the slow reply - I was off on Friday. Hope you had a happy weekend.

This is an IOU Mail! I will give you finalised feedback on the attached cost comparisons and the links below.

PIP


I just wanted to check - on the Pip ones there is quite a lot of negative space (I have checked on my laptop screen and my big screen). Is there a way to resolve this?
And would you mind confirming what the font issue is? I can't seem to see anything.
  1. https://pipfeb25.wolfiq.cloud/policydocs/landlord-insurance/1082023/
  2. https://pipfeb25.wolfiq.cloud/policydocs/holiday-home-insurance/15012024/
  3. https://pipfeb25.wolfiq.cloud/policydocs/holiday-home-insurance/2092022/

SGUA

These look good to me:
  • https://sgua.com.au/policydocs/landlord-insurance-tica/5102021/
  • https://sgua.com.au/policydocs/landlord-insurance-tica/1012021/
  • https://sgua.com.au/policydocs/holiday-home-insurance-tica/5102021/
  • https://sgua.com.au/policydocs/holiday-home-insurance-tica/1012021/
  • https://sgua.com.au/policydocs/holiday-home-insurance/1012021/
  • https://sgua.com.au/policydocs/holiday-home-insurance/5102021/
  • https://sgua.com.au/policydocs/landlord-insurance/1012021/

You'll notice it says "policydocs" and not "policydoc". This is because there is an old redirect on sgua.com.au that'll look for /policydoc/ and redirect the user to claims.sgua. When you approve the links, we will remove the redirection and use /policydoc/ instead of /policydocs/.

Comment on redirection:
I am going to check with Sree but we may just update the actual links in Entsia, depending on what he advises.
I don't think its an issue if we have /policydocs in any case 🙂

Will come back to you tomorrow,

Thanks for all the hard work!

Megs Hollis | Marketing Manager

Proplab - Powering SGUA & Property Insurance Plus
E:megan.hollis@theproplab.com.au
www.sgua.com.au

www.pi-plus.com.au

The contents of this email (including any attachments) are confidential and may contain privileged information. Any unauthorised use of the contents is expressly prohibited. If you have received this email in error, please notify us immediately by Telephone or Email, and then destroy the mail and any attachments or documents.
From: Paul de Chalain <paul@anomaly.digital>
Sent: Thursday, March 27, 2025 7:00 PM
To: Megs Hollis <megan.hollis@theproplab.com.au>
Subject: Re: Fw: SGUA Website | Decommissioning old site
Hi Megs,

Okay, the issue with PIP has been resolved and the work has been completed.

We have added a file to the theme views section for this. Some example documents:

  1. https://pipfeb25.wolfiq.cloud/policydocs/landlord-insurance/1082023/
  2. https://pipfeb25.wolfiq.cloud/policydocs/holiday-home-insurance/15012024/
  3. https://pipfeb25.wolfiq.cloud/policydocs/holiday-home-insurance/2092022/

Also a note - there seems to be a font issue on the site - this is unrelated to the changes we've made.

Have a lovely time off and will chat next week!

Paul

On Wed, Mar 26, 2025 at 1:11 PM Megs Hollis <megan.hollis@theproplab.com.au> wrote:
Great stuff thank you Paul! I will keep an eye out tomorrow and then process this 🙂

Much much appreciated for handling that!
From: Paul de Chalain <paul@anomaly.digital>
Sent: Wednesday, March 26, 2025 4:42 PM
To: Megs Hollis <megan.hollis@theproplab.com.au>
Subject: Re: Fw: SGUA Website | Decommissioning old site
Hey Megs,

Just to let you know that the PIP portion of this work should be completed by tomorrow.

In the meantime, please see the attached invoice for processing.

Regards

Paul

On Mon, Mar 24, 2025 at 8:10 AM Paul de Chalain <paul@anomaly.digital> wrote:
Morning Megs,


Hope you are well.

Quick update: We are done with the work for SGUA. However, we are still facing a couple of issues with PIP but should be able to resolve it soon.
See links for SGUA below:
  • https://sgua.com.au/policydocs/landlord-insurance-tica/5102021/
  • https://sgua.com.au/policydocs/landlord-insurance-tica/1012021/
  • https://sgua.com.au/policydocs/holiday-home-insurance-tica/5102021/
  • https://sgua.com.au/policydocs/holiday-home-insurance-tica/1012021/
  • https://sgua.com.au/policydocs/holiday-home-insurance/1012021/
  • https://sgua.com.au/policydocs/holiday-home-insurance/5102021/
  • https://sgua.com.au/policydocs/landlord-insurance/1012021/

You'll notice it says "policydocs" and not "policydoc". This is because there is an old redirect on sgua.com.au that'll look for /policydoc/ and redirect the user to claims.sgua. When you approve the links, we will remove the redirection and use /policydoc/ instead of /policydocs/.

Regards

Paul

On Tue, Mar 18, 2025 at 4:44 AM Megs Hollis <megan.hollis@theproplab.com.au> wrote:
Great stuff, thank you so much for the update Paul!

Megs Hollis | Marketing Manager

Proplab - Powering SGUA & Property Insurance Plus
E:megan.hollis@theproplab.com.au
www.sgua.com.au

www.pi-plus.com.au

From: Paul de Chalain <paul@anomaly.digital>
Sent: Monday, March 17, 2025 3:19 PM
To: Megs Hollis <megan.hollis@theproplab.com.au>
Subject: Re: Fw: SGUA Website | Decommissioning old site
Hi Megs,

Quick update on this project:

We have managed to upload and import all the documents and the pages. If you go to the backend you'll see a new post type called 'Policy Docs'.

We just need to complete the front end part of the project. Hoping to do so this week.



Regards

Paul


On Fri, Mar 7, 2025 at 8:25 AM Megs Hollis <megan.hollis@theproplab.com.au> wrote:
That is very exciting!!! I haven't yet met Ryan yet no.

Perth is absolutely lovely, and if you can get an arbitrage of services right you would be flying. The lifestyle here is great very laid back / outdoorsy and if Perth was boring 5 years ago, I definitely don't find it boring now especially with sports, restaurants, communities etc.

If you have a credentials deck of your services I can sing the gospel this side! Not sure if mainly custom dev / websites or lots of other things.

We are part of a bigger group (Envest) so if I know the breadth and depth of services I can share around 🙂

Have a lovely weekend,


Megs Hollis | Marketing Manager

Proplab - Powering SGUA & Property Insurance Plus
E:megan.hollis@theproplab.com.au
www.sgua.com.au

www.pi-plus.com.au

The contents of this email (including any attachments) are confidential and may contain privileged information. Any unauthorised use of the contents is expressly prohibited. If you have received this email in error, please notify us immediately by Telephone or Email, and then destroy the mail and any attachments or documents.

From: Paul de Chalain <paul@anomaly.digital>
Sent: Friday, March 7, 2025 12:58 PM
To: Megs Hollis <megan.hollis@theproplab.com.au>
Subject: Re: Fw: SGUA Website | Decommissioning old site
Such a small world! Rowan and I actually went to Pretoria Boys together, hence our connection to SGUA.
Are you enjoying it in Aus? I actually registered Anomaly in Perth and the long-term plan is to grow our Aussie business. Not sure if you have met Ryan Croll yet?

Thank you for the great feedback - You certainly can't beat SA service and pricing when compared to Australia - Services are super expensive on that side. Hopefully we can do more work together in the future. Yup, we are based in Bryanston, Joburg but I do a bit travelling to Cape Town as we have quite a few clients there.

Regarding the redirects - All good, I will let Kyle know:)

On Fri, Mar 7, 2025 at 6:52 AM Megs Hollis <megan.hollis@theproplab.com.au> wrote:
I have been in Perth for just over a year 🙂 Talk about a small world, I joined a media company when I first arrived and then met Rowan at a Stellenbosch University networking event, and he told me he runs an insurance business - LOL! What are the chances.

I wasn't in insurance previously (I worked for Yuppiechef in Cape Town) so it's been quite the adjustment 😉 But it's going well! We are outsourcing a lot to SA as services here are really pricey and you really can't beat the customer service back home 😄

I was telling Rowan this week what an absolute pleasure it has been working with you!!! You've made all our tech gremlins easy, we feel very supported!

Are you based in Jozi?

I spoke to Sree this morning about the redirects for claims.sgua and he said as the site is going to be decommissioned entirely it makes more sense just to change the links in our system, so you can ignore the redirects for that top section of links.

Shout if you need anything else!
Have a lovely Friday,

Megs Hollis | Marketing Manager

Proplab - Powering SGUA & Property Insurance Plus
E:megan.hollis@theproplab.com.au
www.sgua.com.au

www.pi-plus.com.au

Subject: Re: Fw: SGUA Website | Decommissioning old site
Thanks so much Megs!

How long have you been in Aus?

Paul de Chalain
082 745 4555
www.anomaly.digital

Confirming he is admin across:
https://pipfeb25.wolfiq.cloud/ (new site)
https://www.pi-plus.com.au/backend/ (old site)

And I have asked Sree to make him admin of claims.sgua.com.au

Shout if he needs anything else!

Megs Hollis | Marketing Manager

Hi Megs,

We are going to begin with scrapping for URLs. Can you please share an updated spreadsheet of the old and new urls?

Then lastly, Kyle will need access to claims.sgua and to pi-plus websites to add the redirections.

Regards

Paul

On Wed, Mar 5, 2025 at 7:59 AM Megs Hollis <megan.hollis@theproplab.com.au> wrote:
Megs Hollis reacted to your message:
From: Paul de Chalain <paul@anomaly.digital>

Subject: Re: Fw: SGUA Website | Decommissioning old site
Thanks so much, Megs!

I will chat with my developer this morning and get back to you.

Hello Paul,

We would like to proceed with this work.

Can you kindly advise what you would need from our side.

Thank you so much,

Megs Hollis | Marketing Manager

On Tue, Mar 4, 2025 at 5:00 AM Megs Hollis <megan.hollis@theproplab.com.au> wrote:
Hi there Paul!

I am so sorry - I realised that list needed a dedupe -

We are looking at 22 on the claims site (to migrate to new site and set up redirects for)
I.e. From claims.sgua.com.au to sgua.com.au

31 on the new site which I think we need to standardise naming for
Stay on sgua.com.au but fix taxonomy

10 we'll need to do for Pip rebrand (from pi-plus.com.au to pipinsurance.com.au - currently https://pipfeb25.wolfiq.cloud/)

I would like to make sure we:
  1. Have a standard taxonomy across both sites for such things
  2. Use the links to support our SEO, so I have added "insurance" to each URL
  3. If ever we export our list again, all will be in the same format which will make our lives easier
So sorry but could you kindly amend the CE to reflect changes for 63 links - but granted it now means working across 4 sites.

I can then get sign off and check with Rowan if we can proceed.

Thank you so much,
